body:
@yfeldblum I absolutely agree with you. 

What I want to work through to solve is setting the cost to a value where the value was based off the #calibrate method. It is not my intention to do something like this: `ActiveModel::SecurePassword.cost = BCrypt::Engine.calibrate(200)`.

I still think you should be able to set the #cost explicitly. However, I think when adding this to Rails it needs to provide a bit more guidance on how to set the cost instead of just assigning it an arbitrary integer - which I mistakenly did. 

That's why I like the idea of using the `#calibrate` method from BCrypt to either be part of the docs or to be "something" that the developer could use to determine a desirable cost. 

I'm just not sure what the interface should look like while making it simple for a developer to use. I figured I'd go play around with that in a Gem first. :)
